description: Single storey front extension incorporating front porch; conversion of garage into habitable room; first floor side extension; single and two storey side to rear extension; rear dormer; external alterations; vehicle access
decision_conditions:
<p><span style="line-height: 107%;">The proposed first
floor rear extension, by reason of its rearward projection would give rise to
an overbearing, unneighbourly and visually obtrusive form of development which
would result in an unacceptable impact on the amenities of No. 54 Meadow
Road.&nbsp; Furthermore, the level of glazing
in the rear elevation would result in an unacceptable level of actual and
perceived overlooking of the rear gardens of adjoining neighbours.&nbsp; The proposed development would therefore be
contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 D (7) of
the London Plan (2021) Policy DM1 of the Development Management Policies Local
Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of the adopted Supplementary
Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</span><br></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed first floor side extension, due to its lack of a subordinate roof, would result in
unduly obtrusive and incongruous additions to the original dwellinghouse and
would unbalance the pair of semi detached properties which would fail to
respect the character and proportions of the dwellinghouse and the visual
amenities of the locality and would be contrary to the high quality design
aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 (D.1
and D.11) of The London Plan (2021), Policies&nbsp;DM1 A, B (a), (b) and
(c)&nbsp;of the Development Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and
the relevant provisions of the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document
Residential Design Guide (2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>

<p class="MsoNormal" style="margin: 0cm; line-height: normal;">The proposed rear dormer in association with the proposed
single and two storey rear extension would culmulatively result in a obtrusive
development which would subsume the character and scale of the host dwelling and
would be contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National
Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3 (D.1 and D.11) of The London Plan
(2021), Policies&nbsp;DM1 A, B (a), (b) and (c)&nbsp;of the Development
Management Policies Local Plan document (2013) and the relevant provisions of
the adopted Harrow Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide
(2010).<font face="Arial, sans-serif"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"><o:p></o:p></span></font></p>
